trans-unit.source: Retrieves information about the specified named pipe

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information about the specified named pipe

target.mrk: Retrieves information about the specified named pipe

trans-unit.source: Handle to the named pipe instance. The handle must have GENERIC_READ access to the named pipe

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the named pipe instance.
The handle must have GENERIC_READ access to the named pipe

target.mrk: Handle to the named pipe instance.
The handle must have GENERIC_READ access to the named pipe

trans-unit.source: an array with the following format:

seg-source.mrk: an array with the following format:

target.mrk: an array with the following format:

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[0] - True if handle refers to server end, otherwise client end

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[0] - True if handle refers to server end, otherwise client end

target.mrk: $aInfo[0] - True if handle refers to server end, otherwise client end

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[1] - True for a message pipe, otherwise byte pipe

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[1] - True for a message pipe, otherwise byte pipe

target.mrk: $aInfo[1] - True for a message pipe, otherwise byte pipe

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[2] - Size of the buffer for outgoing data, in bytes

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[2] - Size of the buffer for outgoing data, in bytes

target.mrk: $aInfo[2] - Size of the buffer for outgoing data, in bytes

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[3] - Size of the buffer for incoming data, in bytes

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[3] - Size of the buffer for incoming data, in bytes

target.mrk: $aInfo[3] - Size of the buffer for incoming data, in bytes

trans-unit.source: $aInfo[4] - Maximum number of pipe instances that can be created

seg-source.mrk: $aInfo[4] - Maximum number of pipe instances that can be created

target.mrk: $aInfo[4] - Maximum number of pipe instances that can be created
